intro: Tagetes stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf marigold, is a species of flowering plant in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to Central America and is characterized by its vibrant orange and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces daisy-like blooms with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Tagetes stenophylla thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners in temperate climates.
